H0.text: Age is the property that determines a star’s type—red, yellow, white, or blue—when stars form from nebulae of dust and gases.

H1.text: Location is the property that determines whether a star forming from nebulae of dust and gases becomes a red, yellow, white, or blue star.

H2.text: Mass determines whether a star formed from a nebula of dust and gas becomes a red, yellow, white, or blue star.

H3.text: Shape is the property that determines a star’s type—red, yellow, white, or blue—when stars form from nebulae of dust and gases.

A4.text: Stars of different masses are thought to form by slightly different mechanisms.
